basics.name: Jordan Arnesen
basics.label: Mobile developer, Game designer, Pixel Manipulator
basics.summary: Dabbler in all things creative. My passions lie at the intersections of technology, design, gaming, and education.

work.summary: Intelligence, translation, and analysis in support of U.S. military personnel.
highlights: Sorted and prioritized between 500 and 1000 actionable items daily
Generated and documented time-sensitive Iraqi-to-English translations and intelligence analyses
Sustained effective communication of task division between teams working 24/7 missions

work.summary: Store management, leadership, and customer service in video game retail.
highlights: Served as acting manager and efficiently conducted store opening and closing duties
Managed cash and merchandise assets valuing up to $250k

work.position: Cryptological Technician Interpretive (Arabic Translator and Intelligence Analyst)
work.summary: Intelligence, translation, and analysis in support of high priority military operations.
highlights: Optimized task delegation for shifts of over 20 personnel while simultaneously coordinating with and providing valuable intelligence to units in Iraq and Afghanistan
Monitored the function of over $40 million in assets and adaptively troubleshot issues to maintain high levels of mission readiness

Identified weaknesses in existing job qualification standards and developed new methodology for training and assessment, improving operatorsâ€™ linguistic and technical proficiency and accelerating qualification of new trainees

volunteer.organization: Rainbow Community Center of Contra Costa County
volunteer.summary: Provided technical skills on an as needed basis, such as designing graphics for the website or event flyers.

highlights: Participating in and mentoring at high school and college hackathons across the US
Shipping and maintaining CVALT on the Apple App Store
Powermore - an arcade style mobile game, available on the Apple App Store
Designed and created all art and music assets for my game

education.institution: Defense Language Institute Foreign Language Center

awards.summary: For the iOS version of my Echolocation Experience game.

awards.summary: For the Processing/Kinect version of my Echolocation Experience game.

references.name: Stephen Benjamin
references.reference: I worked with Jordan for several years in the Navy, including in the same office for a time. Jordan learns quickly, is kind, treats people well, and is very dedicated to accomplishing whatever tasks are thrown at him in an enthusiastic way.
